title: [Self-Directed] Reflective Action Research-Based Language Pedagogy for Adapting to Remote Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language education experience and online learning platform usage
context.additional_context: Asynchronous classes for in-service elementary educators in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, with formative assessment-driven learner engagement as the core challenge

learning_goals: Learners can systematically reflect on and improve their remote instruction design process at least three times by applying reflective action research methodology.
Learners can develop three or more instructional strategies that consider the characteristics of remote learners (engagement, learning motivation) when designing language education content.
Learners can perform the process of analyzing learner feedback and applying it to instructional improvement using formative assessment tools based on an LMS.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
